titleStmt.title: Sundry queries tendred to such as are, or profess themselves to be ministers of Jesus Christ for clearing the doctrine of the fourth commandement. And the Lords sabbath day. To all that are, or profess themselves to be the ministers of Jesus Christ; these ensuiug [sic] quaeries are humbly presented to be considered, for the clearing of the truth in this weighty controvercy, about the sabbath day.
titleStmt.author: Saller, William, d. ca. 1680.

titleStmt.title: Sundry queries tendred to such as are, or profess themselves to be ministers of Jesus Christ for clearing the doctrine of the fourth commandement. And the Lords sabbath day. To all that are, or profess themselves to be the ministers of Jesus Christ; these ensuiug [sic] quaeries are humbly presented to be considered, for the clearing of the truth in this weighty controvercy, about the sabbath day.
titleStmt.author: Saller, William, d. ca. 1680.

notesStmt.note: Place of publication conjectured by the cataloguer; year of publication conjectured by Wing.
Imperfect; stained with print show-through with slight loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
